reviewText:
Early Access Review

There are certain things that i cannot do, or my girlfriend will leave me. one is to watch star trek the next generation. another one she will not accept is me playing minecraft. because of that, i told her this game is just like minecraft, but made for mature adults like me. just go along with it ok so i dont get a divorce and lose custody of the guinea pigs.

anyway, as far as i can tell, this game is a block removing simulator. you walk around and click on blocks. once you click, the block disappears. all well and good, i suppose, but as a mature adult, i decided to try some adult things.

first i tried to make a hole straight to hell. i got to some red blocks after a while, so it looked like it was working. unfortunately, after a little it longer i fell through the bottom of the screen and somehow ended up floating above the area where i first started the level. the game crashed seconds after.

i then decided to try to make every block in a level disappear. i clicked and i clicked some more, but i don't have that mental disease that makes doing projects like this fun, so i gave up pretty quickly.

i won this from a steamgifts giveaway where they were giving 400 copies. i kid you not dear friends, only 350ish people entered. i should have known what i was getting into when they literally cannot give this game away, but now i know for sure. i wont be playing this one again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

When you ask for a coke and they give you Pepsi

TL;DR: Essentially a second-rate Minecraft that claims to invole the community in the creation of this game, but we haven't heard from the developer since 8th December, 2015; There's still no improvement or nothing that was promised added, such as monsters and items. Even though it's free, it isn't worth your time.

Review:  Voxelized  is a first-person sandbox game where the current objective is... nothing. Upon starting the game, the starting menu is almost exactly the same as Minecraft's, even including the quirky slogan. After you have finished creating a new world, you are spawned in a random location. The enviroment is pretty much flat with a few hills here and there, and the occasional tree in the distance. The graphical style of the game is acceptable, however it has a striking resemblance to the OCD texture pack for Minecraft.The only feature of this game that is playable is that you can build structures, but only with what you can find in the enviroment around you. There is no menu from where you can select materials to build with, you have to right-click on a block so that it is copied to your inventory bar. However building is an incredibly slow process compared to Minecraft.

Audio is very, very annoying as at first it's this long, continous beep that is then accompanied by a drum and what sounds like a fly. This is the only song in the entire game and continues on a constant loop. After 10 minutes of exploration the game suddenly crashed, leaving me with a white screen and the music still playing in the background. I had to manually turn off my PC as even Ctrl + Alt + Delete didn't work.

Before the game was free, you would get card drops for playing the game. But as the game is now free, you will either have to buy them from the market or craft a booster pack. The badges, emoticons and backgrounds are nothing special, there are far better ones out there.

Overall, this game had a great concept, but unfortunately was unable to pull it off. There is no reedeming features for this game currently, and from the lack of updates, I doubt there will be.

If you like my review, any feedback is appreciated and if you would like to see more reviews from me in the future, feel free to follow me!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

(edit 12 september 2015. After an announcement that beta would be released, 3 months has passed. Develepor seems to be gone. So i Beg you, do not support this game anymore)

First off all: As it is a build and explore game, you don't have to expect shooting and survival.
Secondly, it is still early acces.

So i played, explored and build. But at this point the world is empty. They're some trees and grass. No living things. It feels so dead. Even with the changing between night and day, the storms, it doesn't improve.
Building is at this moment very limited. With around 9 block (including doors and windows). Yes you can build, and it works fine. But it doesn't help my imagination. A house is just a building, empty as can be. It just isn't complete.

I know there is a lot of potential. But it is too early yet. Wait after the next few upgrades. NPC's will be coming your way. more blocks. interactions.
And if it really focusses on building a world, and getting occupants in what you build, it will be different then other block-games.

So my advice: at this moment not recommended, so don't buy it unless you want to participate in making it a great game. And adding suggestions about it.
Otherwise wait and give it some time to develop. It is not a bad game, just lacking content. What do you expect in early-acces. But the develepor is working hard on it. And i thought it was a 1-man team. so it may takes some time

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After the succes of Minecraft, many voxel based games have seen the light here on Steam. Some are pretty good, some are pretty bad. Some are shooter based, some RPG based and others are survival based. Voxelized, on the other hand, casts all these things aside and focuses solely on the building part, which obviously was one of the main reasons why Minecraft became so popular.

Aside from walking around there are two things you can do in Voxelized (at the moment): remove blocks (leftmouse) and add blocks (rightmouse). In the time I was playing I was not able to add blocks, so I tried to check the controls in the option menu to see if I was doing something wrong. Apparently, you can not change the controls in the menu, in fact it even says Still Under Construction". In my opinion
recommended: something like a game menu should work.\n\nRight now

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I know absolutely nothing about making games or code.  I have no idea if there's a team behind this game or it's just one person.  But I'm going to compare this game to Viscera Cleanup Detail, a game that I purchased in Early Access and was pleased with throughout the entire process.

This game, Voxelized, is apparently in Beta 0.9.6.  It is, despite what the developer may want you to believe, a Minecraft clone for Steam.  And, from what I've seen of Minecraft, this is a very-dumbed-down version.  VCD had more content available when it was in Alpha 0.5 than this game does with Beta 0.9.6

I don't own the actual Minecraft game.  My interest in owning Minecraft peaks and vallies on a regular basis.  I babysit a tyke who plays it, and I watch her, and I enjoy watching her create and build things.  Of course, I'm also taking child development classes, so watching a child think and create is rewarding in and of itself.

I have a feeling she'd hate Voxelized.

Voxelized is a fascinating concept in and of itself, but there is much work to be done before I'd consider playing this any longer than the ten-minutes-shy-of-an-hour I already have.  I plan to keep an eye on updates and hope for the best, but I'm not holding my breath.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My full thoughts can be found here. I will try and do a full review should this game ever leave Early Access.[www.the-backlog.net]

Minecraft was a runaway hit, and since then many have tried to copy it. Voxelized is no different. After a rocky start, including 5+ months of no updates (despite a promise of Beta in 2-3 weeks")
date: the game has finally started to see some updates. I played some of the game back when it was in "alpha"
recommended: and I decided to come return to it with it in "beta".  What I found was a revamped game... but it's still not much better.\n\nVoxelized's screen is extremely small
hoursPlayed: and it doesn't play well at all with the Steam Overlay. The screens you're shown are pretty much Minecraft (including one of the default splashes saying Not Minecraft). The world creation is an extremely stripped down version of Minecraft
voteText: and you can crash the game if you make it too large. When you enter the world
helpfulPercent: you're plopped into the very corner. You can enable flying mode to get above the sky box
votesHelpful: or dig down to see the moon/sun as it goes below the world.\n\nWhile in the alpha version
votesTotal: the most fun I could find was just going for an infinite loop with falling. The beta version provided even more fun - you can use dynamite to flat out break the game. Should you place it too close to the bottom
votesFunny: things start getting buggy. Place it (and explode it) on the very bottom layer? Things really start to break. (I have a video of this in my full article).\n\nVoxelized is looking very promising at being a bad Minecraft. My suggestion is to just play one of those many other Minecraft clones out there (or just Minecraft itself) and just pass on Voxelized."

Sadly not enough to make a good game imho. Even for a free game this is just not anything you can call a proper game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

SPECIAL REVIEW BONUS ON DEV
Dev is a confirmed publisher of a scam known as Journey of the Light. It is this gamer's opinion that him labeling Voxelized as Early Access is nothing more than a loop whole to scam more players. There is very little proof that Lord Kres ever plans (or had ever planned) to finish this bad minecraft rippoff. Buying this game further supports a confirmed scammer. Please think twice.


-Origanal Post-
As you can tell just from the preview video, this is a basic Minecraft clone. It is cheaper of course, as clones should be, but it fails to even come close to being a proper clone. Now this might easily be from the fact that it is in early access. However, at the current stage the game is in, anyone who is thinking about buying this game when Voxelized is not substantially discounted will end up regretting their decision.

Here's a more detailed breakdown:

Pros-
Cheaper Minecraft
Better initial graphics than vinilla Minecraft
Potential to become better. (Possibly even be involved in making it better)
Trading Cards

Cons-
Most texture packs for Minecraft offer better graphic improvements than Voxelized
Limited content that includes:
No inventory at the time of my review
No fluid dynamics
No explorable caves
No Monsters
Only three type of diggable materials that I could find (Not including vegetation)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This review is for an earlier version than the one currently available.I don't have the time or resources currently to try the game again and see if they fixed any of the issues I mentioned in this review.
For now, I'll leave this version of the review up.

I know it was only 9 cents.
I know this game is still technically in beta.

But that doesn't mean there aren't any things that are really, really flawed in this game.

Pros:+Trading Cards

Cons:-Terrible controls
-Music gave me a headache and there's only 1 song, with no option to turn it off
-Boring gameplay with nothing to do
-The Options menu is unavailable
-Saving doesn't work
-Blocks randomly change even though I didn't tell the game to change my block type
-Doors won't work
-Inventory system is disabled
-The worlds are completely empty with nothing inside of them
-Game runs at 10 FPS (it's not my PC, I can run games like Battlefield, CS:GO, Need for Speed: Rivals with at least 30 FPS)
-Placing blocks as you're jumping makes you fly up in the air
-No HUD
-You don't take any damage
-No enemies
-Graphics consist of colored blocks (feels like Dead Bits, just even ♥♥♥♥♥ier)

Verdict:Don't buy it. The game is still early access, so the issues I have listed might be fixed sooner or later, but right now, not even at 0.09€, I wouldn't recommend this game.

Review will be changed once the developer releases more updates.

Voxelized (v0.4.8. anyway) gets a score of:2.1/10.0
At least it's not nearly as bad as Bad Rats...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Voxelized is one of the earliest of Early Access games I've ever played. It is, frankly, amazing that they are accepting money for it at this stage of development. Luckily I didn't have to pay money for what looks to be a tech demo as I got my key from a Greenlight promotion run by the dev, but you should not by any means pay money for this until some actual game arrives.

The first thing I do when I start a game is try to go to the options menu. This game doesn't even have one (it has a button, but it's grayed out, along with several other features). Once you get into the game things only go downhill. In a block building game, the first thing you're going to want to do is mess around and build some blocks, right? The inventory is apparently still a work in progress too because it's just a list of buttons on the left side of the screen that can only be accessed while the game is paused; not to mention they're all default Unity buttons, something I haven't seen Air Control. Air Control! After figuring out how to get a block in my hand (figuratively, because of course there's no block nor hand) my first mission was to build a tower and see how high I could get. This simple task proved impossible. In games like Minecraft you can jump while facing down, place a block, land, and repeat to gain height quickly. In this game, trying this tactic is a fool's errand. The game will randomly decide to bounce you into the stratosphere, usually straight up but not always, and after falling from a fairly significant height (and many other smaller ones along the way) I decided I didn't want to go through the struggle of trying to get back up and gave up, shut down the game, and came to write this review.

There are other technical details I could pick on like the awful music (at least they do provide separate volume sliders for everything, which is a positive) or that it's uglier than Minecraft, but really what it comes down to is that there's precious little game there right now, and what is there doesn't work very well. You've got a handful of block types with an inventory that is as slow and tedious as the molasses-like movement system, and...well, that's it really. The state of development is similar to Minecraft's indev, or even earlier. If you absolutely must get your Minecraft fix on Steam and think Voxelized is the ticket, maybe it'll eventually be worth your money, but for now it's safely a pass.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EDIT: Please take this review with a grain of salt, I've not played it since this reviews last update and will be replaying to re-review it.


Voxelized is a nice looking game from the screenshots, and looks like there is promise to the game. The video isn't the best but it is.. kinda all there is to the game right now.

When you log in, read the green words below the language option screen or you'll have to go back and relaunch the game the read the commands. (see update below}The option bar isn't working right now, I feel this will eventually allow for key-binds and volume prior to launching a map. As of right now you need to launch a map to get the volume controls. I hope the controls for this game get moved to the options soon, even if you cannot rebind them yet so you can look at them without relaunching the game if you miss them on launch. Same with the volume, I'd love to be able to change volume both in and out of the maps.

You jump like a spaceman on the moon, it's quite funny but a bit annoying when you just need to jump a tiny bit and have to wait to float back to Earth. There are only two maps, which is fine for a new launch EA game. I have not been able to reacess my saved game once I leave, when I relaunch the map it spawns an all new map for me to start over again.

You get everything you need without doing a thing, just pick 1-9 (and place them in order on the ground so you know which item is to which key) and hit RMB to place them. There isn't a hotbar yet, so you have no way of knowing your items without doing this prior to building.

There isn't much right now, but as this updates I'll be updating this review. Right now, yes it's fun.. but not for that long. At least for me, but if it keeps going and adds content like; water, animals and mobs to survive against it'll be nice and fun.

The price tag of under $4 is nice and when they add a bit more to the game I feel it'll be worth the cost but as of now I can't say it's worth it.

If you like building and just going around doing that without any limits, then yes you'll love this game but for me I need just a bit more. I'm still messing around with this game and if something comes along to make me feel different I'll edit this review.

Thank you.

--------
There was a day 1 patch for save game, aside from the volume levels not staying where I'd set them the save game works now. Jumping is more resonable.

If they keep this up it'll be a good game.

If you can handle an EA (Early Acess) game, and feel like this will keep going in promised direction I say buy it but if you're wanting a game with depth right away... wait to buy, still isn't worth it.

---------
As promised I'm updating with patches.

You can now see the commands when you pause your game in game now, tis nice :D

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Buy this game if you like:

-Random crashes
-Minimalist graphics (not in the good way)
-Unoriginal titles
-Creators that think they are innovating
-One of the worst menus in existence
-A resolution is stuck on 800x600 (and when you exit, it doesn't change back!)
-Using 2GB of RAM (for a Minecraft clone?)
-Cursors permanently stuck as the up-down arrow when in the menu
-Only being able to change the resolution by Alt-Tabbing to desktop, but even then the game will not display correctly
-2 graphics options (Quality" and "Render Distance")
-The WORST movement head-bobbing ever seen in a video game
-Invisible walls... in the form of flowers.

Only get this game so you can use the GM8 file as a 49-cent example of how not to create a Minecraft clone."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EA Review October 2015

This game merely serves to show that without minecraft on steam - steam users have a market void that gets filled with a bunch of pretenders and wannabes, this is very bad. The music is madness inducing, non of the basic mechanics you would expect in a game like this are present, just procedural generation of a very limited amount of blocks that you can flat out delete with a mouse click, I didnt figure out how to create blocks out of thin air , nor that I felt like I wanted to either. Nothing to do nothing to see here. This is junkware that clutters your library, and is a testament to the lack of quality control going around on steam, whom, are happy to allow fake games to be sold so they can have their ridiculous trading card economy. I feel bad for paying the nerd tax.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

NEW REVIEW:

- Looking around feels much better now
- Choosing blocks is now easier, but i think you should do so you can scroll infinite, and when you come to the last item, you get back to the first one
- Jumping feels more realistic
- Random terrain generation is now here, but it only generates trees, that could be a bit better...
- Max Fps is not set to ulimited anymore, its set to 30, from what i know right now, you can't change it.
- There is now much better sounds for breaking and placing blocks, but i think the sounds is really close to being the same sounds as Minecraft.

There is one block, that i think looks like a bookshelf, but when i place it, there is just a black texture where there should be books.

Also i don't think the tnt block should have the same texture on all sides.

You can see where it is supposed to be dark. (under the ground)

If you make a high tower, then go down to the bottom, break the 2 block at the bottom, then go under the tower and placing a block inside yourself, then you will get transported all the way to the top of the tower.

If you want ideas to things you can make for next update, i would probably add better terrain, like hills, seas, bushes and stuff like that. Tools, food and health could also be great. You can still find other things to add from the old review.

WOULD I RECOMMEND IT?: Well, its much better than before, but as it is right now, i don't really think it is a game you can play for hours. There is 13 placeable blocks, and there isn't anything survival over it.

I think this game will become much better, and i will keep updating this review as newer updates come. Just be patient, and wait. :D

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EDIT: Revisions to the review will be marked with a '*'

So I JUST played it to get a sense of what's been recently done to the game, and here are my observations:
-No actual start menu or pause menu quality.
-After the game loads, prompts tell you what the few hotkeys are and what they do in-game.
-The few hotkeys that there are mostly make sense, however why not have a menu you can access by pressing esc (it currently exits you from the game) or F10 (Blizzard shoutout), which has a submenu with all the keybindings?
-The one map (which is different from the earlier version of the game) is incredibly small. It takes all of 3 literal seconds to walk across it either lengthwise or widthwise.
-There is no way to check your inventory to see what blocks you've picked up or how many you have.
-Even if you could it doesn't matter, because you can't place the blocks you pick up. For all intents and purposes, they wink out of existence the second you pick them up.
-Even if the blocks didn't wink out of existence, there is no reason to pick up any blocks (aside from terraforming), because the blocks you place and the blocks you pick up are entirely different. You don't have to pick up a thing in order to start building.
-There is no way to expand the small square of land to build on. Digging down a few blocks you hit upon an unminable layer. There are invisible walls around the sides of the map, so you can't make a block bridge to go out. As far as I tested there is no limitations on upward construction.

As it stands I cannot in recommend the game in the current state that it is in. Even disregarding the fiasco of every other game and greenlight that has come from this dev, and focusing solely on the game as it is right now at this point in time. Once a bit more work goes into it I would be willing to recommend this game (something I never thought I would say, but inspite of [or perhaps because of?] everything that has happened in connection to this dev in the past, I gotta say I'm starting to get the impression he really is trying. I believe in forgiveness, even if I don't forget the reason why forgiveness was needed in the first place.).
*********************************************************************************************************************
REVISIONS:
~ESC now pauses the game and brings up a menu.
~There is now an option when you start the game to create a new game world, in varying sizes (I have not tested this feature extensively, but at the lowest world size it loads fairly quickly)
~Start menu and pause menu now feel a bit more polished (not fully explored yet, as time permits I will explore more)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is easily the most unfinished game I've ever played. It's basically just Minecraft's creative mode without any of the unique blocks or infinite worlds. You're just wandering one of four pre-made maps and placing and removing blocks. Also, if you're playing in windowed mode, your mouse will constantly exit the window.

The most fun I had playing this was digging into the core of the earth and falling from the sky. It was mildly amusing.

EDIT:

The game got an update and the developer is warning people that old reviews may not be accurate, so I decided to update my review as well. The gameplay is unchanged, but they added a few new blocks. All but one of them behave the same, but one block they added was TNT. Although Minecraft already has this, it is cool to see in this game as well. They also fixed the problem with the mouse curser leaving the screen. Oddly, they removed three out of four of the maps and eliminated the ability to drill down into the core of the earth.

Overall, the game is improving. However, I still don't believe it is complete enough to be on Steam and I stand by my negative opinion of the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Not sure this is even up to the level of a tech demo in Unity. Has a basic space, with placeable and removable cubes, one of the default objects in Unity. Anyone who has done a little bit of work with the engine could replicate this in a few hours I would think. In fact, if you want an even better game, I suggest making it yourself using the tutorials here:
http//store.steampowered.com/app/269570/

It's only $1.99 for GTGD S1 when not on sale, nd you can even watch the vids free on Youtube anyway if you prefer. The Unity engine itself is free as well. I reccommend just getting GTGD S1 instead (you don't even have to code the game if you don't want to learn, you can just build the example source code project into a runnable game) and making a better game in this genre (actually has some FPS elements in the tutorial game you build) the way YOU want, instead of some nebulous community" suggestions that may or may not come later in this game.

Update:
As expected
date: it turns out the "dev" was in fact a scammer trying to make quick money by releasing essentially fake games on Steam."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Alrighty, Voxelized.

I like the concept of a basic Voxel-Based Building Game, Though i do feel at the moment the game feels a bit empty; Sure it's in its early stages of Development but to be honest a game in it's early stages doesn't deserve a spot on the Steam Store and especially with a $4 Price Tag. Nevertheless i like the game alot and i'd be interested in seeing how it develops in the Months to come. If there's another thing i've got to criticize about the game is the lack of features, Basic things like changing Settings and a fully functional Main Menu are things i'd expect from a game as early in development as this one is. Also; The lack of things to build with; Since the game heavily encourages creative minds only having 8 things to build with is severely distrusting especially when i dumped $4 of my hard earned work money into it.
While i don't necessarily like to give negative reviews since the Developer wants Honest ones i gave him mine as Honest as i can make it.

I'm sorry, But i just don't think its complete enough for me to recommend it at all. It's not fun in the slightest. Maybe with a few customizable Graphics Options or Mouse Sensitivity Options it would be worthy of a recommend from me but at the moment, No.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Paying for a pre-alpha experience? No thanks.

There is literally nothing but hills and trees on the surface and just solid rock below it. Doesn't help it's a Minecraft wannabe when I don't even like Minecraft.

When you release a game, at least include content, I could probably make a better effort at this with 20 mins in unity.

All I can say is thank god for steam refunds, it may have only cost a few cents, but it's money this developer doesn't yet deserve. Who knows, in the future this could be big, but this is not how anyone should release a game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Imagine your favourite apple product. Now imagine a fake one. Now imagine it has manufacturing defects. Now imagine that a big red truck drives over it. Ready?
This game is a poorly made copy of Minecraft. It's a big phoney, fake, counterfeit, forged and a reproduction of a great game and it has so many errors! You will wish you we're that big red truck that drove over this game and you will wish your 9cents back.

To the developers: Thank you for making me going to the dictionary looking for synonyms of something you should be ashamed of. Go find something else to do, like fishing for example. Open a bakery shop, for crying out loud! But don't you ever make some sort of game again, you're just making a fool of yourselves.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This rather pathetic tech demo/test program passing greenlight and being for sale in the actual Steam store clearly exemplifies just how broken Steam is at the moment.

The price, without discounts, of this... thing is €3.99 in the EU1 store, but there is nothing here. Sure, you can move around in the world and you can remove and add some blocks, but that is pretty much it. We can go all metaphysical and ask what is a game?"
date: but I'm afraid that just about any way you ask that question
recommended: the answer is "something that isn't Voxelized".\n\nNow
hoursPlayed: the developer seems to be saying that he wants the community around his... creation to shape it
voteText: and let him know in what direction to take it
helpfulPercent: but that is disingenuous
votesHelpful: at best. To me
votesTotal: that is him basically saying that he's completely devoid of any ideas or ambitions of his own
votesFunny: and he wants the "community" to design his game for him
commentsCount: and that would be... you know... pretty bad. I wish I could come up with some other explanation
column16: but seeing as how he's provided no framework and presented no design or plan of his own for what Voxelized is supposed to become
column17: it becomes clear that this really is something considerably less than just a very early alpha of a game.\n\nIt truly is no more than a simple test program
column18: that
column19: through the massive faults of the Steam Greenlight process and Steam vetting of what is offered up for sale in the store
column20: has been elevated to a for-sale product. And no amount of labeling as "Early Access" can change the fact that this... thing
column21: has no business whatsoever being for sale to unsuspecting customers.\n\nHell
column23: then perhaps a Greenlight page would have been a good place to get it
column25: this developer has broken new ground - instead of letting your paying customers just be your QA
column26: he's asking them to also be the design team. I strongly suspect that the only reason he's not making them also be the development team
column27: is that he lacks the programming chops to build the scaffolding needed around his... product to allow it to be modded."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I thought that this might be a slightly bad Minecraft clone that, for 9 cents, I could get some fun out of. Little did I know that this is probably one of the worst games I've ever seen on Steam.
Now, I've bought plenty of what I like to call indie bargain bin" games on Steam
date: which are games that cost a few cents and you can sell their trading cards for a profit
recommended: and not once have I ever thought to myself that I actually would have been better off just buying a cosmetic for Dota
hoursPlayed: until now.\n\nThe game is just plain broken. Not even early access needs content broken
voteText: just downright broke. My first impression of the game came from intro screen that looked like your generic Unity interface you learn from any tutorial and had to choose one of 4 modes
helpfulPercent: there's no difference besides one being flat. The weirdly slow walk speed when I started
votesHelpful: I thought it was weird
votesTotal: but kept on going. Then I broke a few blocks and attempted to place some to find out I couldn't. I found out you could place blocks but to change colors you need to press esc and click on these buttons that are allows present that are numbered 1-24
votesFunny: you can only click them while in the esc pause menu though. Each button corresponds to a block color
commentsCount: but they're labeled as numbers so you need to try them all to get the color you want.\nI don't think I can accurately describe how bad the game is
column16: but basically imagine the first ever build of Minecraft
column17:
but make the game about 20 times more janky.


TL;DR: A terrible Minecraft clone that hoped to get you to buy it because Minecraft isn't on Steam. With the advent of Steam refunds I hope developers of scams like this have to stop developing games like this."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't even know what this game is.
This looks like a school project to me.
One that has no creativity in it whatsoever.

The menu... Menu? All I have is the option to play the game, quit the game or change my language?
You really can't justify the menu with the game being on alpha state.
And besides why does this game have so many languages? It doesn't need anything else than english. atleast at this point.
Okay let's move forward.. So four levels and only two of them work.
Then we get to the fun part. Or so I thought. I don't know what's up with that camera sensitivity, but it's terrible. Trying to build something with it is painful. Oh. And the building! Let me open my inventory real quick.. Wait.. It's in progress? After a moment I realised that those numbers on the left are actually different materials. Accessing them is painful. but for some reason the block on your hand changes randomly too. Changing the audio options doesn't work. Some of them don't even move.

Yeah.. I think I have told you, dear reader enough. Do not buy this game. If you like this kind of games, buy minecraft.
You don't need this game. It has nothing unique to offer and the developer seems to have noticed it too since the Beta was supposed to come few weeks ago..

Utsuho does not approve this game. 0/10 Burn it in the hell of blazing fires

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay...I did not think that I would have so many problems with a game that only costed me $0.09, but damn this shouldn't be in the steam catalog even under the title of early access. I'll be blunt: This game is a really crappy minecraft clone with terrible...well everything. Music is mediocre, animation is non-existent, gameplay is horrific (really crappy inventory screen and it's confusing as hell to figure out how to select a building block), etc. In addition to that, those that may pick up this game for the one tempting, seemingly simple achievement should also stay away. That achievement is broken beyond hell (in the sense that it's nonexistent) and there isn't even any code for an achievement in the source files. Only reason that this piece of crap has so much gametime on my profile is because I alt-tabbed for trading cards. Hopefully brain-dead fools that actually want the badge can help me get my money back.

tl;dr: instead of paying 9 cents for a game that is literally there to leave a blemish on your steam library, shell out the $26 to buy minecraft instead. You'll get a hell of a lot more for what you spent.

If I hear that this game gets any better during the early access period, then maybe I'll change my review. Not that i'm counting on it though.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Voxelized is block building game made in Unity Personal Edition. Currently it is really bare, even by Early Access standards imo. There are tons of other open world voxel building games out there, and I can't even see the potential for this one right now
The interface is poorly designed at the moment, with you having to press escape to pause the game and select a block each time you want to place a different block. What you select are numbers that correspond to a block, with no preview of the actual block, making the process more tedious. Like I said, there are a ton of other voxel block building games out there that have done this much better, most of them have a system where you drag blocks to assign to your number keys. The fact that this simple tried and trusted method for selecting and placing blocks that has been done over hundreds of times is absent from the game really shows how early in development this is.
The blocks for now are mostly just different colours of a simple cube. They are all pretty useless at the moment
There is currently no physics implemented, other than the player falling due to gravity, and no multiplayer
It is also worth mentioning that the developers have also made Journey Of The Light, another game with poor user review scores
There needs to be much more before I can recommend buying the game for any reason other than profiting from the trading cards when it's on 90% off sale. Currently, it looks like a lazy cash grab.
Rather get Unturned or Trove, which are free.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Minecraft Indev Version 0.001 was more advanced than this.

Seriously, this is nothing more than an attempt at a Minecraft clone, with none of the pros involved. Imagine Minecraft Classic (the version where you had a set inventory of placeable blocks) and no ability to fly, and you basically have Voxelized. No animals, changing environments, mobs, or really anything are included in this game. For something that came out in March, this isn't even early-access worthy, more like a Jr. High Schooler's computer project.

If there's any saving grace to this game, it's the fact that it does actually run. There is a selection of blocks to pick from, they can be placed, and what's there, though there's very little, does seem to function.

I suspect a toddler or anyone under the age of 3 might be able to get some enjoyment out of this, if only for its rated N" for "Nothing" nature and the fact that there are some pretty colors. If you are over the age of 3

This game is broken, far, faaaar beyond repair.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After noticing there was an update, I decided it would be good to re-evaluate the game. My original review can still be found at the bottom. Here are some things I saw after the update:

Improvements:
The textures look much better.
Blocks can be selected by scrolling the mouse will.
Selected block is shown in the lower left of the screen.
There are a few more block types.
Fly mode was added.

Things that could still be improved:
Flowers have collisions enabled so you can't walk through them.
Still no enemies to give the player a reason to do the things they are doing.
The player can only jump about 1 block high which makes it difficult to jump up a level.

All in all, this version of Voxelized is an improvement. However, I still can't recommend buying it.


[Original Review] - Pre November 2015

This should not be called an Alpha release. Even calling it a concept test at this stage is premature. The game is in such an early state, there is NOTHING to do. reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game had a lot of potential, but unfortunately it didn't reach that potential. Here's why;

Pros:
- Very cheap compared to most Minecraft clones.
- Jumping physics are OK, but not the best.
- Simple.

Cons:
- Bright colours will make you beg for mercy.
- Not recommended for use on setups with 2+ monitors, as the mouse can leave the game window when looking around.
- Developer abandoned the game, so don't expect any updates if you get this.
- Soundtrack can easily become annoying after a while.
- No flying. 'Nuff said.
- You have to pause the game everytime you want to switch blocks.

Because there are more cons than pros, don't get this game. My personal rating for this game is 4/10.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

During my 5 minutes or so with this game, my assessment is this:
Voxelized is an early access title where you click on blocks, causing the blocks to disappear. That's it.
On the launcher you can customize your resolution, change graphics, and bind keys. Keep in mind that there is only one option: Ultra High. At the main menu you have 6 buttons: Play, Multiplayer, Options, Credits, Quit and Languages. Multiplayer and Play are both inaccessable at the moment, though. You would think that at the least you would be able to access an options menu where you would be able to change something like resolution or audio settings, but the game doesn't even have that. One it does have, though, is a slider for music on the main menu. That doesn't work. But it plays music anyway.
When you click Play
date: it changes to a screen with 4 world options: A normal world, a flat world, a hardcore world, and a bonus world". The last two don't work
recommended: so I went with the normal world. Now that I was in the actual game
voteText: hoping I would be able to access some sort of settings or inventory. What I got was a list of controls
helpfulPercent: some audio sliders and a "climb up blocks" slider. You heard me right
votesHelpful: a slider to toggle between two options. If there's any praise I have for this game
votesTotal: it's about the audio sliders for different things like music
votesFunny: building sounds
commentsCount: and birds chirping
column16: which can't be said for lots of modern triple A games.\nWhat I didn't notice however
column17: was an inventory. The game has none. From my understanding
column18: you can only place the last block that you left clicked on
column19: and you have an infinite number of that block. Weird.\nObviously since this game literally has no content
column20: I started to dig down. But once I got to some red tiles underground
column21: I fell through the bottom of the world and found myself falling from the sky onto the surface of the world again. Trippy.\nThis uninspired
column22: incomplete game has absolutely no future or potential at all. It's not fun
column23: and never will be. It's not even worth buying for a profit off the trading cards
column24: you have better things to do with your time than play this."

You know how when you boot up Minecraft, theres this sense of adventure and discovery as you explore the land?  The excitement of seeing a jungle temple or a village in the distance?  The way your stomach drops when you turn a corner and there's a creeper two inches from your face?

Voxelized: Because Fun is Overrated!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Short Early Access Review:

25/04/2015, 0.7 Hours played.

The game itself is promising. A Minecraft-style game, basically build and explore. At the moment though, it's very... Lacking. I only have minimum playtime as mouse sensitivity made it nearly unplayable.

Pro's:The performance is great.
The day and night cycles as well as the weather effects could be brilliant when cleaned up.
A choice of a few languages before you get in to the actual game.
A few maps to choose from and explore.
Con's:Mouse sensitivity is horrendous, makes the game hardly playable.
Lack of building block choices. You're stuck with 9 blocks which leads to a very bland house.
Some textures need to be polished up.
Music and sounds are a bit out of place.
Very basic map terrain. Hills or flatland.
No 'Option' menu as of yet.
'Creative' mode only.
Overall lack of content.
Like I said before, the game is promising. With more content promised the game could turn out extremely awesome but in it's current state I could not recommend buying it unless to support the developer, as it's quite possibly unplayable past an hour, if you can get over the sensitivity issues. But what can you expect in early access?

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game feels like something coded in a couple hours and then put on Steam. There's practically no reason to buy this game except to make your game list look bigger. Everything about it is just awful, 2 maps with no tutorial basically forcing you to either figure out what to do, or just quit. The latter is the better option. This game also likes to take a massive dump on people who like to 100% complete the achievements in a game by making 1 achievement for the game and making it unobtainable.


I would honestly just avoid this game at all costs until it is greatly improved upon.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Bought the game for trading cards at 9cents selling the cards at 5cents nice profit

but this isn't a game as of yet
I have no clue what direction the devs are going with this game but at the current state its broken

it crashes alot
there is no inventory and building blocks is a puzzle at start
you have to press ESC and then click on the numbers on left hand side to chose a block very weird way to work

also there is an option for window mode (well done devs) the problem is this game is borderless meaning your mouse will leave the screen and you leave the game so you really cant do window mode
but even at full screen I got out of the game and into my 2nd monitor

the game itself?
it aint a game there is nothing to do but build
and the things you can build is very limited with only 25 block
you cant die you dont need food there are no enemies
all you can do is build

will have to wait and see what the devs will do over time
for now I cant recommend it unless you buy it now for 9 cents and sell the cards for a small profit

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I will not reccomend this game for a few reasons.

1) the game distorted my screen upon launch
2) the world did not load, even on the smallest size
3) even after closing the application using task manager, my screen was still distorted
4) i had to restart my computer, hence #4
5) i coulnt use any icons on my monitor so i had to use the off button on the hardware section of my pc
6) read 1-5 carefully again

i suggest you dont get this game, even if it is free (at this time)

P.S. the only thing i found even remotely fun is to place tnt everywhere and blow up the entire world

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This product cost $0.09 at the time of this review.

Pros:
* Day/Night cycle
* Actually launches/works
* You can build
* Limited Weather effects
* Okay" lighting

Cons:
* Limited Music
* Chunk loading/world generation is very slow
* No death
* No NPCs
* Worlds need more thickness
* Singleplayer Only


Voxelized honestly should not even be released in such a playable state. There is little to actually do as most of the gameplay appears to not have been added yet. The textures of the blocks are (hopefully) provisionary with super simplistic characteristics lacking any substantial depth to them. The music of the game appears to be on a loop with the most memorable tone being "doot doot
date: doot doot doot". Windowed mode does not lock your mouse cursor to the window and can cause issues while breaking blocks or building.\n\nI personally believe that this game is another Minecraft clone however for 9 cents I was honestly surprised that it ran relatively decently and had a day/night cycle. Voxelized needs alot of work to actually be sustainably enjoyable in my opinion and features such as multiplayer need to be incorporated as well
recommended: which would help in going down that route by a large margin.\n\nOverall I would recommend grabbing a copy of this game for super cheap and keeping an eye on it. Given enough time Voxelized may become something "completely different"."

This game is crap and everyone knows it, so i leave here a pancake receipt:

HOW TO MAKE PANCAKES
REALLY EASY WAY:

1 Cup of flour

2 Tablespoons of sugar

1-2 Teaspoons of baking powder

1 Teaspoon of sal

1 Cup of milk

1 Beaten egg

1 Table spoon of alimentar oil


Mix all the ingredients i said together
Preheat your pan at medium - high heat (i recommend using a bit of cookery butter to grease the pan if you are not using a ceramic pan)
Pour the mixture in the pan (the quantity u should put depends of the size of the pan and how you like your pan cakes, beware if you pour too much, you pancakes will get undercooked in the middle )
When the pancake starts to make bubbles, flip it! (you can use ninja techniques but a fork or large spoon also works )
When the pancake is cooked in both sides, remove it from the pan and now you can put everything you want on it or eat it simple.

Note: you can add other ingredients to mixture like bacon, fruits, cereals... (try the bacon, it is so damn good!)

Enjoy your delicious pancakes instead of this horrible game!

Early Access Review

Now i know this is still in early access, but there's just just not many features and so little to do within it that it makes it feel like this game is really boring... even bad maybe.

You should work on the loading screen, when i first saw it i thought maybe something wrong happened and i was stuck or i accidentally broke the game lol, couldn't tell because there wasn't a progress bar or anything to indicate what it was doing. Also i don't know how to explain it, but the controls are a bit weird to me, both walking and looking around in the game feels like the character is walking on a ground coated in butter, i kinda felt  a little motion sickness after exploring" a little in it.

I don't think it feels early access ready yet
date: it doesn't even really feel like a game at this point in the developement. Just work on it for a long while
recommended: implement some more features and i'll give it another go."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EDIT BETA 0.9.4
Sounds have been removed? I can't seem to hear them anymore and there is no sound menu. I still don't see a controls menu so I can't control my guy and that means I can't play this game properly (I will not talk about this again until it is fixed) . The flowers are nice. If you fly, you go forward like you're walking (you don't stay on the same level, which I find quite annoying. I tried to load the biggest map size but it froze, so that sucks.
It's getting better, but still has a lot of work to become a good game, even for the 99 (for me 10) cents: 3.5/10

EDIT BETA 0.8.1
Changes have been made: sounds of when you break and place blocks (the sounds are from minecraft). The menu has disappeared. Also there is only one map and still no inventory. If you scroll, you change blocks (but don't use the TNT, it is loud as hell, it scared me pretty hard) Since I use 'azerty', I was not able to change the controls. I pressed escape to find the options or invertory and then the game closed. For now the update has made the game worse. Hope you fix it: 1,5/10

Original review:
So yeah, this game has a bit potential... A bit. It's kind of a clone of minecraft. I encoutered a bug that i could not place a block where wanted it to be. I also have no idea how to change blocks. I hope the developer works on it. Plus, it costed me only 9 cents, so why not. I can be a good game, but in this state it is not. Please, work on the game! 2/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pros:+Im not even going to count being free, because thats its only redeeming factor so far and i know it wasnt free for a while, Remember that people were ACTUALLY SUPPOSED TO PAY FOR THIS

Cons:-Sets my resolution to lowest possible and has no resolution settings

-White screen on world creation, no loading bar, no indication of it working, no way to exit

-Had to forcefully close it with task manager, my screen set didnt even restore resolution

-Horrible lag, i shouldnt be getting only 13 fps even if i am on max graphical settings

-Stuck on corners of blocks

-No flight or mobs

-No mods or texture packs

-No control menu

-No rebinding controls

-No multiplayer


Games that have been and will be free that have the same features but better1. Robocraft (grindy bot building and fighting game with more or less equal aesthetic appeal)

2. Trove (grindy hack and slash mmorpg with more variety)

- sleepy music

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Voxelized... The game where you can remove and build blocks.
Actually I can't say more about this game"...

The description says: "Build a Town. Build a City. Build an entire World."
- I really can't believe that there would be anyone having fun by playing this.

The control is very bad - you can't even hit the "Options" in the main menu (even if it's an early access game - this should be clickable
date:
lol!)

You can choose between different blocks in the upper left corner by clicking a number but you have no clue which number is which block.

The graphic? Well I only see blocks.. and they're not really detailed..

At the moment the only reason to recommend this game are the trading cards. By buying this game for 0.09€ (actual discount on steam itself) you can make profit with them..That's the only reason why this game gets 1 out of 5 stars from me.

Rating: ★☆☆☆☆"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game has a LOT of potential, but this is VERY VERY Early game access. There is minimum that can actually be done and it seems to crash a lot (at least on my laptop). The Developer is VERY vague as to how to get the achievement and there is discussion about it possibly being broken.

That aside, it was 0.09 cents for the game, so get it, get the trading cards, sell them/gem them/craft them, and move about your day until the game progresses.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Alpha version review.

This game need something more than just better graphic or equipment - this game needs to get most basic fixes like mouse going out of screen in window mode (and that's makes press one of the number of items from left sided content menu where you can choose block to put), option menu ingame (for example to fix mouse going out, change resolution [options same like while running game + option to disable or enable weather] and more) and changed movement way (this basic unity engine movement is not good, feels slow to stop moving - make it stop 2x faster or 1,5x faster should be good).
Another thing is price of game - this game isn't playable for while but still it cost so much (i understand that working with it takes long time and buying / doing graphics for game takes time also but it's to much for while) so in my opinion maximum price of game for while should be like 5€ and no more (just game for while looks like something that everybody can make in week or month by own in unity engine). This game need also script for spawnpoint like set spawn point or spawn point in ground insteed of in the sky.
Building in this game isn't bad, some of textures are high quality but still i need to wait for any content menu for easier usage of blocks or just for icon what number from left menu is what block.
For while i'm looking for incoming updates to see where's this game going.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Oh my gosh guys, calm your ♥♥♥♥, it's still in Early Access and may have bugs. I really like the dynamic lighting in this game :3. Sure it may look like a 'Minecraft copy', but there are tons of games that are retros of Minecraft.

Pros-
Simple
Dynamic Lighting
Dynamic Weather
Day to Night cycles
Ability to control whether your character can climb the terrain (For those slow, laggy computers :3)
Monthly bonus maps :3

Neutrals-
Inventory is a W.I.P
Not everything is given a well texture
The original map isn't infinite
No mobs
Hasn't been updated in a handful of weeks
No tools
No survival bars (hunger, thirst stamina)
No running
Hardcore is closed ATM (Possibly will be opened with mobs)

Cons-
No tunnels or anything to explore
Unable to replace blocks
When you dig a hole down, you're spawned outside the actual map and looped falling
Can get boring after a few minutes (Nothing to give you the ol' razzle dazzle)
No cats ;~;

WHO KNOWS, HE COULD BE DOING A BIG-♥♥♥ UPDATE WITH MOBS, NEW BLOCKS, AND OTHER ♥♥♥♥. We just need to be patient. Stop putting him down, even if he may be a 'scam artist'.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Game is poorly made, Dev seems to have no interest in improving his work. I personally left the game on for 32 hours. The achievement is a sham. I can tell you free and clear this game isn't worth the .09 it costs.

-----update 11/14------

Mojang can now sue the dev for copy right infringement.  The game has had some improvements, however these improvements cause the game to crash irregularly. Everything I said  previously still stands.

-----update 12/12------

Game shows signs of improvement.  It does not crash as often as it did.  It feels like MC did durring its early alphas.  I wish the dev would move away from making a MC clone, but that is this game.  If you want original alpha MC on Steam here it is.  The achievement is gone (thank God).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

In my opening statement, I will explain how we can be justified in believing that god(s) do(es) not exist. I would like to thank debate.org and muted for making this debate possible.

It should be noted that there are two types of atheological arguments that I shall be using in this debate: (1) The first is called logical arguments - these attempt to show that the concept of God is self-contradictory or logically inconsistent with known facts; (2) The second is called evidential arguments - these arguments attempt to show that the known facts are inconsistent and incompatible with the Christian God. These will include Biblical errors, contradictions, etc.


Pro 1: The Argument from Non-Cognitivism.

The following syllogism is taken from Magic8000’s debate1:

There are three attributes of existents which concern us particularly, these being:
Primary Attributes - The basic nature a particular thing is composed of. What a thing is, specifically, that it may do particular things or affect those around it in a particular way. The following two types of attributes provided below can only be applied to a thing if they can be related to an existent’s primary attribute and the primary attribute is positively identified
Secondary Attributes - Character traits or abilities a particular thing may enact or possess. examples: being generous, kind, powerful, wise
Relational Attributes – What we associate with the character. For example, in the case of President Obama, the fact that he is the President of the United States is an example of a relational attribute.
B as well as C are dependent upon and must be related to an existent’s A in order to be considered meaningful.
The term “God” lacks a positively identified A.
Because of this, the term “God” holds no justified A, B, or C. (From 2)
However, an attribute-less term (a term lacking A, B, and C) is meaningless.
Therefore, the term “God” is meaningless. (From 3, 4, 5)
Therefore, the god concept is invalid.
When someone says to you, God exists"
date: how do you normally respond? For most atheists
recommended: the answer is simply "prove it." However
hoursPlayed: this is a bit premature. Before we can get into whether or not God exists
voteText: we must first know what a God is. Indeed
helpfulPercent: many intellectuals have discussed and debated the subject as to what God is throughout history. The fact remains that from its original form
votesHelpful: the ANC has stood as one of the most significant threats to the Christian/Theist worldview.\n\nFor example
votesTotal:
consider the following dialogue2:

Mr. Jones: “An unie exists.”

Mr. White: “Prove it.”

Mr. Jones: “It has rained for three consecutive days—that is my proof.”

If this exchange seems less than satisfactory
votesFunny: much of the blame lies with Mr. White: his demand for proof was premature. Mr. Jones has not specified what an “unie” is; until and unless he does so
commentsCount: “unie” is nothing but a meaningless sound
column16: and Mr. Jones is uttering nonsense. As W. T. Blackstone puts it:\n\n“Until the content of a belief is made clear
column17: the appeal to accept the belief on faithis beside the point
column18:
for one would not know what one has accepted. The request forthe meaning of a religious belief is logically prior to the question of accepting that belief on faith or to the question of whether that belief constitutes knowledge.”

Conclusion

Until my opponent specifies what a God is
column19:
the god-concept is invalid and “god” is just an utterly meaningless sound.

Pro 2: Incoherence of God’s Attributes

The following argument is tied in nicely with the last. Theists have attempted to provide us with a list of what God is. According to the 1968 National Catholic Almanac
column44: but fail to answer the primary attribute. Moreover
column46: the above definition is incoherent. If God is incomprehensible and ineffable
column47:
how can the other attributes of God be known if he can neither be understood nor described?

Anything with contradictory attributes cannot exist.
God has contradictory attributes
Therefore
column48:
God cannot exist.
Pro 3: Failed Prophecies in the Bible

According Deuteronomy 18:21-22
column49:
if a prophet speaks in the name of the Lord and that prophecy fails then he is obviously a false prophet. There are prophecies within the Bible that have failed.

Ezekiel

Failed Prophecy on Tyre

Ezekiel 26:7-14
column50: “For thus says the Lord: "Behold I will bring upon Tyre from the north Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon
column53: and with horsemen and a hosts of many soldiers. He will slay with the sword your daughters on the mainland; he will set up a seige wall against you. He will direct the shock of his battering rams against your walls
column54: and with his axes he will break down your towers...With the hoofs os his horses he will trample all your streets; he will slay your people with the sword and your mighty pillar will fall to the ground...they will break down your walls and destroy your pleasant houses... I will make you a bare rock...you shall never be rebuilt
column56:
says the Lord God.”

The whole passage prophesied the attack and destruction of Tyre by Nebuchadnezzar. However, none of this happened. After a long siege of 13 years, Nebuchadnezzar lifted his siege and compromised with the people of Tyre. Thus, king Nebuchadnezzar did not destroy Tyre as Ezekiel said that it would.4

Ezekiel later admitted his error:

Ezekiel 29:17-20, ...the Lord God came to me: “Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon made his army labour hard against Tyre; every head was made bald and every shoulder was rubbed bare; yet neither he nor his army got anything from Tyre to pay for the labour that he had performed against it...”

I rest my case. This game is cancer

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Original Review:October 25 2015

I've given this game the benefit of the doubt for far too long.

-The Achievement doesn't work ( the forums have discovered there is no code for the achievemnt)

-The music is a terrible loop

-The inventory is unusable

Many people would forgive these issues due to this game being in early access but considering the developer hasn't been active since June and has stopped responding in the forums it is very likely this game will never be updated.

I bought this game for $0.10 and still took the time to warn people of this scam, it's that bad.

If the developer happens to read this: please, update this game, it does have potential but as it stands it is a complete waste of money.



Updated ReviewMarch 31
I was going through my game library and I noticed this game again. To my surpise I noticed that the developer decided to make updates, after many months of inactivity it seems as if the developer took note of the negative reviews his games have gotten.

So anyway, is it any better?
yes, definately.

-The music is much more bereable than it was before.

-The inventory isn't great but is leaps and bounds better than it was before.

-The achievement is gone (sigh...) but at least the developer is being honest now and the patch notes state that the developer plans on adding achievements in the future.

-I didn't complain about artstyle in my original review but looking back at my old screenshots in comparison to now there is clear improvement.

-The game is now free!

As I originally said, this game has lots of potential, and now the developer is trying to make something out of this game. Considering this game is free and there are promises of future updates I have to change my review to positive.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

In my opening statement, I will explain how we can be justified in believing that god(s) do(es) not exist. I would like to thank debate.org and muted for making this debate possible.

It should be noted that there are two types of atheological arguments that I shall be using in this debate: (1) The first is called logical arguments - these attempt to show that the concept of God is self-contradictory or logically inconsistent with known facts; (2) The second is called evidential arguments - these arguments attempt to show that the known facts are inconsistent and incompatible with the Christian God. These will include Biblical errors, contradictions, etc.


Pro 1: The Argument from Non-Cognitivism.

The following syllogism is taken from Magic8000’s debate1:

There are three attributes of existents which concern us particularly, these being:
Primary Attributes - The basic nature a particular thing is composed of. What a thing is, specifically, that it may do particular things or affect those around it in a particular way. The following two types of attributes provided below can only be applied to a thing if they can be related to an existent’s primary attribute and the primary attribute is positively identified
Secondary Attributes - Character traits or abilities a particular thing may enact or possess. examples: being generous, kind, powerful, wise
Relational Attributes – What we associate with the character. For example, in the case of President Obama, the fact that he is the President of the United States is an example of a relational attribute.
B as well as C are dependent upon and must be related to an existent’s A in order to be considered meaningful.
The term “God” lacks a positively identified A.
Because of this, the term “God” holds no justified A, B, or C. (From 2)
However, an attribute-less term (a term lacking A, B, and C) is meaningless.
Therefore, the term “God” is meaningless. (From 3, 4, 5)
Therefore, the god concept is invalid.
When someone says to you, God exists"
date: how do you normally respond? For most atheists
recommended: the answer is simply "prove it." However
hoursPlayed: this is a bit premature. Before we can get into whether or not God exists
voteText: we must first know what a God is. Indeed
helpfulPercent: many intellectuals have discussed and debated the subject as to what God is throughout history. The fact remains that from its original form

votesTotal:
consider the following dialogue2:

Mr. Jones: “An unie exists.”

Mr. White: “Prove it.”

Mr. Jones: “It has rained for three consecutive days—that is my proof.”

If this exchange seems less than satisfactory
votesFunny: much of the blame lies with Mr. White: his demand for proof was premature. Mr. Jones has not specified what an “unie” is; until and unless he does so
commentsCount: “unie” is nothing but a meaningless sound
column16: and Mr. Jones is uttering nonsense. As W. T. Blackstone puts it:\n\n“Until the content of a belief is made clear
column17: the appeal to accept the belief on faithis beside the point
column18:
for one would not know what one has accepted. The request forthe meaning of a religious belief is logically prior to the question of accepting that belief on faith or to the question of whether that belief constitutes knowledge.”

Conclusion

Until my opponent specifies what a God is
column19:
the god-concept is invalid and “god” is just an utterly meaningless sound.

Pro 2: Incoherence of God’s Attributes

The following argument is tied in nicely with the last. Theists have attempted to provide us with a list of what God is. According to the 1968 National Catholic Almanac
column44: but fail to answer the primary attribute. Moreover
column46: the above definition is incoherent. If God is incomprehensible and ineffable
column47:
how can the other attributes of God be known if he can neither be understood nor described?

Anything with contradictory attributes cannot exist.
God has contradictory attributes
Therefore
column48:
God cannot exist.
Pro 3: Failed Prophecies in the Bible

According Deuteronomy 18:21-22
column49:
if a prophet speaks in the name of the Lord and that prophecy fails then he is obviously a false prophet. There are prophecies within the Bible that have failed.

Ezekiel

Failed Prophecy on Tyre

Ezekiel 26:7-14
column50: “For thus says the Lord: "Behold I will bring upon Tyre from the north Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon
column53: and with horsemen and a hosts of many soldiers. He will slay with the sword your daughters on the mainland; he will set up a seige wall against you. He will direct the shock of his battering rams against your walls
column54: and with his axes he will break down your towers...With the hoofs os his horses he will trample all your streets; he will slay your people with the sword and your mighty pillar will fall to the ground...they will break down your walls and destroy your pleasant houses... I will make you a bare rock...you shall never be rebuilt
column56:
says the Lord God.”

The whole passage prophesied the attack and destruction of Tyre by Nebuchadnezzar. However, none of this happened. After a long siege of 13 years, Nebuchadnezzar lifted his siege and compromised with the people of Tyre. Thus, king Nebuchadnezzar did not destroy Tyre as Ezekiel said that it would.4

Ezekiel later admitted his error:

Ezekiel 29:17-20, ...the Lord God came to me: “Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon made his army labour hard against Tyre; every head was made bald and every shoulder was rubbed bare; yet neither he nor his army got anything from Tyre to pay for the labour that he had performed against it...”

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Voxelized is at this point a garden variety sandbox game that might cost more money than it's worth. It's extremely early access and is still in the early, early, early stages of development, meaning that it has a ton of issues and there's not much to do. If you're looking for a cheap game that's lots of fun or an indie alternative to Minecraft, I honestly wouldn't recommend this.

There are so many issues with this game right now. The movement is choppy, the design is generic, the blocks differentiate themselves very little from already existing sandbox games, there's a jumping glitch, there's no inventory, no way to see which block you're using, no way to interact with doors, and the only achievement in game is not only a secret achievement- but it's broken.

With all of those complaints, you're probably wondering why I recommended this game - and here's why: It's a work in progress. This is one of the earliest versions of a game I've ever seen released on Steam, and the awesome part is that the developer is listening to people's feedback on the game and using that feedback to help improve it. Think about that. If you buy this game now, you can literally help shape what it becomes. How awesome is that?

Right now, this is something that you have to accept at face value. It's getting worked on, and there are a lot of issues that you're going to need to put up with if you intend to play it at this stage, but it's only going to get better from here. If you really like sandbox games, if you really like taking chances, creating, seeing games evolve, or having your opinion matter, this is probably something that you should look into.

You might have seen my Day One: Garry's Incident review, if you haven't, go see it.

Anyways, if you have you know I love good games, this is one of them (like the previously mentioned one)

The launcher's image thing isn't placed correctly in the centre.

So I get in the game and I find that I can only choose New Game and Quit. Options, you have been forgotten
I choose new game and get a vast selection of four levels.
Oh wait,
two levels.

I choose the first one and mess around a bit. I jump, look down and hit a block. The game freezes.
Good optimization.

I can't change it.

I pause the game to save my wonderful creation.
The button is greyed out and says 'To save press the R"' button'
Now
date: what's the problem with having a button on the menu? Was it really necessary to grey it out?\n\nAfter saving it
recommended:

reviewText:
Early Access Review

and yet another minecraft clone, sadly with no twist, and thankfully with no twist.

i may have only took few minutes to play this but that was more than enough to really show it's errors, but also it's promises.

first of all, this game ran on my grandma's computer on full resolution with more than 120fps, and i would love to say it's because of good optimization, but i can't, since the game is anything but optimized, but that shows that the game is more than amazing running on any rig, even though the graphics are a bit iffy, but still, it runs smoother than a baby's tush.

the mouse is extremely awkward, there's input lag, a severe one, and that's an understatement when you play an actual voxel based game like the original Ace Of Spades then this... yeesh, it's like playing as a praraplegic in a wheelchair, and sometimes it feels like it.

movement is very laggy, reminiscent of a car accelerating and remaining on first gear, and that's a really bad thing if you're going for a fun and arcady game with building and tight movement in mind as creators would like full control of their feet on the floor, not sliding about on ice.

the options or rather lack of options is not very good, give us at elast the option to change the sensitivity, that would be great with the horrible camera control, and as for the graphics, i believe that it should remain as it is, perhaps refine the textures to make them seamless.

the idea is decent, the engine is refined, the game sadly is horrible as of yet, but i have hope for this game, perhaps extra help and more time taken to edit the game would do it much better, perhaps even include like a voxel-like creator where users can create their own assets and put them in the environment like beds, bunks, TVs, and a ton more things.

i really hope this game has a good idea in mind, otherwise, it's as good as many people played it said, another card retrieving game where you just get your money's worth selling cards collected from it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Oh dear. Imagine minecraft, with none of the whimsical mystery of minecraft. Its in or past greenlight at this point, but with patches being few and far, and content being stale as week old bread left out in the open with nothing to keep the player drawn in, this was a flop. More or less a desperate cash-in with the ever evolving growth and popularity of block based games on the market but slapped together so lazily and with haste, i dont even see how this game has a community. With a developer who rarely communicates with the people, and from what the forums have taught me, its best to avoid this alltogether.

It was less than a dollar when i bought it, so i guess that is pretty cool. Has 1 achievement, with a super vague description, and trading cards to farm, for those who want badges.

Cant turn off birds because screw you. You will listen to the birds and you will like it.

Unfinished. Also, this developer is infamous for a fiasco involving his other game that was seen as a scam and actually became unavailable to purchase. So no doubt this game was half-♥♥♥♥♥ to make a quick buck on steam.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is basically a demo, a prototype,  the very bare foundation of a voxel, minecraft-like game in Unity. It has a very basic world gen with trees and hills and it does seem to be infinite which is a very nice hurdle to have got over, if they have. It rains sometimes and you can destroy and place blocks. (To add blocks press escape then select a block type blindly from the list on the left).

The problem is that this is all the game is: a very, very basic building tool, and even then the mouse is so sensitive that building is a pain and you have to remember what block number is what.

I wouldn't think that this is going anywhere, especially given the enormous discount in the summer sale.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EDIT: The one part any smart person cares about - profit.
I bought this game for 9 cents.
I got 3 trading cards, two that were 8 (6) cents each and one foil that was 12 (10) cents. I made 22 cents from selling cards, and 13 cents in profit (8 cent profit without the foils).
Worth it. And now, the review.

You know a game is going to be bad...
When you launch the game to find it uses ♥♥♥♥♥♥ Unity and the only graphics option is Ultra High (such lies)
Made using Unity (personal addition) - undoubtedly at least 2x cheaper than a non personal addition.
When you arrive at the main menu to find that the only available buttons are Play (single player) and quit; the multiplayer, options, and credits buttons are there, but not usable (there's also a music slider at the bottom, like, you know, an option, as well as music credits in the opening title screen. Could've used 2/3 of those buttons right there.)
When you press 'Play' to find that there are only 2 maps (with 2 more not available) in a Sandbox game...
When you choose a map and immediately fall to your death... oh, wait, there is no health feature implemented yet! saved by bad game design!
When you look around and see a hand-made Minecraft texture pack, except all of the blocks are only 1-2 solid colors
When the only available feature in-game is to break blocks with incredibly high mouse sensitivity (another great option that all games have...) and no way to place them...
I didn't get any farther than this because the mouse sensitivity turned me off (as well as everything before that) but I'm sure that there isn't a single thing in this game yet, it looks like the devs just stopped developing it as soon as they found out it was greenlit...

Dev 1: Hey, we should make a Minecraft clone!
Dev 2: Ok!
*1 day later*
Dev 1: Oh ♥♥♥♥, I just realized; we have to actually make standard game features, and not just gameplay!
Dev 2: Oh no!
*30 minutes later*
Dev 1: Lmfao this game got greenlit already!
Dev 2: Finally we can stop working on this ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game!

*present day, selling for 9 cents because no one will buy it otherwise*
I love devs.
1/10
