reviewText:
Early Access Review

Here's my Early-Access review about Voxelized. I'm going to update the review, if there are changes in the game. Please scroll down to read the update, too! This is why I changed my mind about recommending it or not!

Grafics: 3/10
The grafics are ok, if you play it windowed, but if you play fullscreen they are really bad. You see pixeled borders of the blocks and after a time these grafics are exhausting for your eyes.

Control: 4/10
Wasd, Space and mouse are ok, but I don't like that you need F4 for fullscreen as well as F5 and F6 to load/save your game. Moreover it's bad that you have to remember the name of your saved data to load it again.

Gamplay: 5/10
The annoying music is away and I like that fact, but a volume control would still be nice. Moving around and building something would be more interesting on different maps and not always on the same small one.

Story: -/10
-

All in all: 4/10
At the moment I would not recommend this game, because there is still a lot to do for the publisher. I would still not describe this game as ♥♥♥♥" or "worst game ever"
date:
because it's an Early-Acces Game and this says that the game isn't finished yet and the publisher want's us to tell him what he can do better. And with this review I am doing so.

***Update 24.11.2015***
There is a menu now with a nice sound. I like it. You are able to change the world's size and it's name to load it again. I tried it with size 512
recommended: but it didn't want to load; just a grey window. I tried it again with size 120 and there was a loading screen showing you what the engine is doing at the moment. That's nice! There are flowers now and different landscapes in the map. That's amazing! There is a bug that you cannot see which block you are using (should be in the left corner i think)
hoursPlayed: but I think that is easy to fix. Graphics did not improve a lot but it's still ok in a small window.\n@Lord Kres: You did well!\nFinishing my updated review
voteText: I saw that there are different times of the day. Nice. All in all a very good update. This game will get a thumb up now.\nI

Step 5: Loading...
Step 6: Dig straight down for about a minute until you start falling
Step 7: Continue to fall over and over
Step 8: Repeat step 7 until satisfied
Step 9: Realize that the whole point you bought the game was to build cool crap
Step 10: Place block is broken
Step 11: Repeat step 7 some more
Step 12: Close the game and uninstall it

In all seriousness this game seems like it would be a good little Minecraft knockoff if they fixed block placing. If they fix this block placing issue, I would definitely recommend this as a cheap Minecraft alternative without all the fancy features Minecraft has implemented.

11/10 - Best falling simulator I've bought to date

p.s. For some more fun you can make patterns where you fall. Don't mess up because you can't place a block to fix it

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Although I have minimal time on record, Voxelized is a pretty good game with some interesting terrain and block types.

Right now the game is limited to content, which is why it’s in Early Access. Right now you use the numerical keys to cycle blocks which has very limited functionally at the moment, however Inventory will be coming soon apparently, so that will add more functionally and object types to the mix of things.

If you’re looking for a cheap voxel sandbox, this could be the one you’re looking for despite lots of similar ones on the market, although there are limited blocks at the moment they’re actually pretty good and detailed

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't know what is going on with positive reviews for this game, but to sum up the game in one sentence: it's like minecraft before it was sold as alpha and made it's made with unity. I don't know why there are so many defending this and saying it's not minecraft, but that's what it is: minecrafts creative mode before it hit alpha.

Remember how minecraft had monsters, crafting, some decent graphics and music, interesting stuff to dig - even as alpha? Well, this is like that without any of those. Empty world, you can only choose blocks from pause menu what to put into world, graphics are mostly plain colors, music is some really random and annoying midi song, world loops (digging under level brings you on top of it). I do know that alpha does mean it's in state where it's supposed to be kinda empty, but right now I'm reading it should be going to beta in few weeks?!?

Even if it's just under euro it still shouldn't be on steam at this stage when there's almost nothing in it. It's more like an someones first game project instead of game to be sold. I guess some may be happy for minecraft clone that costs less than ice cream, but I guess that group would be one that can't afford to buy legit copy of minecraft for some reason.

Also I'm not fan of created by the community". Why engage people to your game when its basic functions aren't even in place? And what is there to be created by the community exactly?

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Mulla ei ole hajuakaan mitä helvettiä tän pelin positiivisissa arvosteluissa on meneillään

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So I turned this game on after downloading it and I didn't really know what to expect.
I was greeted with a screen that asked me to chose my language which is nice because a lot of people prefer to speak their native language so that is a big plus.
Anyway, I got into the game and spawned in. The music in the game is nice and the sound effects are pretty decent too.
I do not have much play time but I feel like I know what to expect from the game.

+Pros --
Nice music and sound effects
Language menu
Basic, but nicely generated world designs
Like Minecraft, the building is great.
I found that Stone" or "Cobblestone" in this game looks like grey bricks xD

-Cons --
The controls - Movement is a little clunky and feels still when strafing right and left
The mouse is a little bit high in sensitivity - I can't find anywhere to change it
No options menu as of yet

Lord Kres has done an AMAZING job so far
date: can't wait for future updates on this game and it is worth picking it up if you love Voxel based games. Kudos to you Kres =D\n"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Alrighty, i've played for half an hour and so far these are my comments.

- Music is ok, doesn't really match though
- The green in this game could be toned down a lot, frikken neon burning
- Sometimes the blocks change when breaking/placing
- Mouse comes out of screen
- Sometimes your player seems to switch between 2-3 blocks tall
- Doors don't work properly currently, you move up the block the door is made of
- Sound options don't work
- Yes it does look like a minecraft clone, but whatever
- Mouse sensitivity is wack, would like a slider

The game has some potential, it's in alpha stage and is only a dollar.

Do I reccomend this? Yes, it gives you a dollars worth of fun in it's current state, you get what you paid for.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I must say I am amazed at how far this game has come since I first bougth it. At first it was a broken alpha at best that did nothing and looked like it was a dead project( no updates for ~3-4 months) with many calling it a scam. I can now say however there seems to be very reglar progress on the game and each new version is better that the last.

At this stage it is basically a very limited Minecraft clone with very limited block types and textures. You can now build structures but that is about it at the moment. As it is still early access I will forgive these flaws and look forward to seeing continued development on it and to see where the developer planns to take it.

I now give this game just a reccoment as it is now mostly functional but only to those who want to build basic buildings otherwise watch this project and see what it is like in another 3-6months.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Everyone is going on and on about how bad this game is, when really, it's not as bad as they say.

Sure, it lacks content, but that's because it's early-access, it's not a complete game. Just because it isn't finished makes it bad. Let me give you an example;

Agar.io

A game where your a circle and eat other circles. That has so little content it's amazing how it is so popular, with major youtubers playing it.

The dev now updates the game weekly, and I'm always happy to give the new version a go. You know what? I'm actully proud of him. Even though he get's horrible reviews, he still persists with updating this game. Good job on him. Pat on the back.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Let me start by saying that I really don't have the kind of creativity that a game like this needs in order to make the most of it so, there's that...but I still would recommend this game in a heartbeat!

Now that that's out of the way, let's get to the meat and potatoes of this game...it shows a LOT of promise, and if what I've read in other reviews is true then it's in the hands of an ideal dev. I've not had much experience of dev's interaction with the community as I don't stick around IN the community much myself, but by all accounts, this dev actually gives a damn and listens with an open mind, so there's that too.

For me, personally, there's plenty that needs work - like the variety of blocks available for building with, the mouse sensitivity, the menu layout, the music, the suddenness of the change in day/night cycle, some of the textures (I'm looking at YOU, sky, dirt and grass) but I have faith that that will all improve as we go.

Although I got a free copy of this game, having played it I can definitely say I would have quite happily bought it at full price if it meant supporting the dev in his efforts, and if you're someone who would be excited to help support the game as it develops I would heartily recommend you buy it. IF, however, you only want a finished product, then bide your time and buy it when it's more complete. DO buy it though, even if you wait.
